sections.title: Synthetic Financial Report for Extraction Testing
sections.content: Synthetic Financial Report for Extraction Testing
Prepared on July 27, 2025

The company recorded consolidated revenue of $386,899,681.88 for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2024, reflecting a year-over-year increase of 5.5%. Net income attributable to common shareholders was $49,203,237.61, resulting in diluted EPS of 1.08.

sections.content: During the year, we invested $27,559,605.22 in capital expenditures, primarily related to capacity expansion in our North American manufacturing facilities. Management expects these investments to reduce unit costs by approximately 8.6% beginning in Q2 2025.

numbers.context: During the year, we invested $27,559,605.22 in capital expenditures, primarily related to cap
investments to reduce unit costs by approximately 8.6% beginning in Q2 2025.

sections.content: Operating cash flow totaled $108,770,746.70, compared to $102,906,979.55 in the prior year, driven by improvements in working capital and lower inventory days on hand (from 87.1 to 67.3 days).

numbers.context: Operating cash flow totaled $108,770,746.70, compared to $102,906,979.55 in the prior year, d

sections.content: The Board authorized a share repurchase program of up to $56,032,370.03 through December 31, 2026. No dividends were declared during the period.

sections.content: Our debt-to-EBITDA ratio improved to 1.80x from 2.31x, reflecting both higher EBITDA and scheduled amortization of term debt.

numbers.context: Our debt-to-EBITDA ratio improved to 1.80x from 2.31x, reflecting both higher EBITDA and sch
Our debt-to-EBITDA ratio improved to 1.80x from 2.31x, reflecting both higher EBITDA and scheduled amor

sections.content: We continue to see strong demand in the enterprise segment, while consumer markets remain volatile. Management anticipates continued growth in operational efficiency through process automation and selective outsourcing.
No single customer represented more than 7.6% of total revenue during the period. Geopolitical risk remains a factor in our EMEA segment, but pricing discipline has helped preserve gross margin.

numbers.context: No single customer represented more than 7.6% of total revenue during the period. Geopolitical

sections.content: The company’s effective tax rate was 16.6%, impacted by R&D; tax credits and the release of certain valuation allowances.

sections.content: Our culture emphasizes transparent communication, disciplined execution, and long-term value creation for all stakeholders.

Liquidity remains strong, with total availability under our revolving credit facility of $223,475,916.69. The company remains in compliance with all financial covenants.

sections.content: Management’s base case assumes mid-single-digit revenue growth in 2025, with gross margins stable to slightly expanding as supply chain normalization continues.
